description.narrative: The project development objective is to support the socio-economic reinsertion of demobilized ex-combatants within local communities.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Economy and Finance, Republic of Mali
National Disarmament, Demobilization and Reinsertion Commission (CNDDR)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Independent auditor, Schedule 2, Section V, 2, (ii) | Description :On or before three months after the EffectiveDate, the Recipient shall: (ii) hire independent auditors for the project with terms of reference, qualification and experiencesatisfactory to the Association and in accordance with Section III of this Schedule.

Finance Agreement :Workshop, Schedule 2, Section V, 2, (i) | Description :On or before three months after the Effective Date, theRecipient shall: (i) organize jointly with the Association a launching workshop for the project involving all stakeholders.

title.narrative: Members of communities report social acceptance of ex-combatants (disaggregated by age and gender)
Percentage of total project beneficiaries who report acceptance to return of demobilized ex-combatants (disaggregated by returning fighters vis-a-vis residing members of host communities)
Vulnerable demobilized ex-combatants satisfied with specialized project support (disaggregated by gender, and specific physical andpsychological needs)
People in the project area aware of the project's beneficiaries' targeting criteria (Disaggregated by gender and geography)
Percentage of ex-combatants who received, from those who requested, additional drop-in reintegration support (disaggregated by age,sex, armed group affiliation and economic activities)
Percentage of identified eligible former combatants who received specialized support (disaggregated by age, gender and physical andpsychological needs)
Percentage of ex-combatants who successfully completed orientation, counseling and skills training (disaggregated by age, sex, and armed group affiliation)
Percentage of targeted former combatants reporting satisfaction with services provided by the program (disaggregated by age, sex, armed group affiliation, economic activities and support received)
Demobilized Ex-combatants are satisfied with the composition and delivery of the start-up kits
Demobilized ex-combatants satisfied with follow-up support (disaggregated by gender, economic activity, agrarian/non-agrarian)
Percentage of demobilized ex-combatants availing income generation opportunities (disaggregated by age, sex and type of economic activities)
Number of demobilized combatants who have undergone socioeconomic reinsertion (disaggregated by age, sex and armed group affiliation)
Demobilized ex-combatants linked to respective projects (disaggregated by gender and economic activity, individual or economic association, (agrarian/non-agrarian)
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits that are actually addressed (Disaggregated by gender)
Percentage of total beneficiaries in local communities reporting higher security and reconciliation (disaggregated by age, sex, andarmed groups affiliation)
Number of planned small-scale socioeconomic infrastructure subprojects successfully completed (construction or rehabilitation)
Number of host community's members, including at-risk/vulnerable people, who completed on-the-job skills training related to the construction, rehabilitation and maintenance of infrastructures
Number of host community's members, including at-risk/vulnerable people, involved in income-generating activities as a result of support provided by the project
Number of beneficiaries in target communities with improved access to socioeconomic infrastructure (disaggregated by sex)
Participants in consultation activities during project implementation (number)
